episodeTitle: The King of Beasts that will Cross the Ocean! The Dream Ship's Magnificent Completion!
episodeTitleJapanese: 海を臨む百獣の王！夢の船堂々完成！
episodeTitleRomanized: Umi o Nozomu Hyakujū no Ō! Yume no Fune Dōdō Kansei!
description: The Straw Hats receive their new bounties and meet Iceburg to view their completed ship, the magnificent Thousand Sunny. Meanwhile, the Franky Family steals Franky's swim briefs to force him toward joining the crew, leading to a chaotic chase through Water 7.

events.title: Sanji's Bounty Photo Disappointment
events.description: Sanji learns that his wanted poster doesn't feature a photograph but rather a poorly drawn sketch because the photographer forgot to remove the lens cap. Despite being excited about his 77,000,000 Berry bounty and 'Black Leg' epithet, he becomes depressed about the photo mishap.
events.significance: Comedic moment that establishes Sanji's vanity and provides levity after the intense Enies Lobby arc. This running gag continues throughout the series.

quotes.text: Why is my wanted poster a sketch?!
quotes.speaker: Sanji
quotes.context: Sanji's reaction to seeing his poorly drawn wanted poster

events.title: Nami Questions Her Bounty Photo
events.description: Nami receives her 16,000,000 Berry bounty with the epithet 'Cat Burglar' and a provocative photo. She becomes preoccupied with discovering who took the photo, as the photographer pretended to be from a magazine.
events.significance: Establishes Nami's concern about her public image and adds character depth through her vanity.

events.title: Chopper's Humiliatingly Low Bounty
events.description: Chopper is dismayed to receive a bounty of only 50 Berries, having been mistaken for the crew's pet. He receives the epithet 'Cotton Candy Lover' which further emphasizes the Marines' lack of understanding of his role.
events.significance: A recurring comedic element showing the World Government's underestimation of Chopper, despite his significant contributions to the crew.

events.title: Thousand Sunny Unveiled
events.description: Iceburg unveils the Straw Hats' new ship, the Thousand Sunny. The magnificent vessel features a lion figurehead, is at least twice the size of the Going Merry, and is packed with incredible technology including the Soldier Dock System and Coup de Burst. Built from rare Adam wood, the ship represents Franky's dream ship design.
events.significance: Major milestone in the series as the crew receives their iconic second ship that will carry them through the rest of their Grand Line journey. The ship embodies Franky's craftsmanship and represents the crew's growth.

quotes.text: The King of Pirates should sail a ship graced by the King of Beasts.
quotes.speaker: Franky (via Iceburg)
quotes.context: Franky's message about the ship's lion figurehead design philosophy

events.title: Soldier Dock System Revealed
events.description: The Thousand Sunny's unique Soldier Dock System is introduced, featuring six rotating chambers controlled from the steering wheel. Each chamber houses specialized vehicles and equipment, showcasing Franky's innovative engineering.
events.significance: Introduces a key feature of the Thousand Sunny that will be utilized in future adventures, demonstrating Franky's genius and the ship's versatility.

events.title: Franky Family's Plan to Force Franky's Recruitment
events.description: The Franky Family, led by Zambai, devises a plan to force Franky to join the Straw Hat Pirates by stealing his swim briefs. They understand that Franky wants to join but is held back by his loyalty to them, so they take the decision out of his hands.
events.significance: Shows the deep bond between Franky and his family, and their selfless desire for him to pursue his dream of seeing his ship sail the world.

events.title: The Great Underwear Chase
events.description: After the Franky Family steals his swim briefs, Franky chases them naked through Water 7, leading to the destruction of several buildings. The chase becomes a relay as each family member passes the briefs to the next, with Franky in hot pursuit and the police ineffectively trying to stop him.
events.significance: A hilarious and memorable sequence that demonstrates the chaotic comedy One Piece is known for, while also showing Franky's embarrassment and the lengths his family will go to for him.

events.title: Zambai and Franky Family Beg Luffy
events.description: After the chaotic chase, Zambai and the Franky Family earnestly beg Luffy to take Franky with them now that he has a bounty and is wanted by the World Government. They emphasize that Franky needs to leave Water 7 for his own safety and to fulfill his dream.
events.significance: Demonstrates the selfless love the Franky Family has for their boss, willing to sacrifice their time with him so he can pursue his dream.

events.title: Luffy Agrees to Take Franky
events.description: Luffy calmly agrees to take Franky as the crew's shipwright when the Franky Family begs him to do so. He notes that he had been seeking a shipwright anyway, showing his acceptance of Franky despite their rocky start.
events.significance: Shows Luffy's practical leadership and his recognition of Franky's value to the crew. This moment sets up Franky's official recruitment.

events.title: Straw Hats Join the Chase
events.description: Luffy, Sanji, and Zoro join the underwear chase, grabbing the briefs and preventing Franky from retrieving them. They work together to capture Franky and force him toward the crew.
events.significance: Shows the crew working together in a comedic situation, using their teamwork for recruitment rather than battle.

events.title: Franky Launched to Scrap Island
events.description: Sanji and Zoro grab Franky and launch him via cannon toward Scrap Island. Luffy follows using his Gomu Gomu powers as rocket propulsion, bringing the briefs with him.
events.significance: Sets up the final recruitment scene where Luffy will make his formal offer to Franky in exchange for returning his swim briefs.

events.title: Luffy's Bargain for Franky
events.description: On Scrap Island, Luffy makes Franky an offer: he will return his swim briefs if Franky joins the crew as their shipwright. This puts Franky in a position where he must choose between his pride (getting his briefs back) and staying in Water 7.
events.significance: The climactic moment of the episode, setting up Franky's official acceptance in the next episode. Shows Luffy's unconventional but effective recruitment strategy.

quotes.text: The King of Pirates should sail a ship graced by the King of Beasts.
quotes.speaker: Franky (via Iceburg)
quotes.context: Franky's message about the design philosophy of the Thousand Sunny

quotes.text: Why is my wanted poster a sketch?!
quotes.speaker: Sanji
quotes.context: Sanji's dismay upon seeing his poorly drawn bounty poster

themes.description: The episode emphasizes moving forward after loss, with the Thousand Sunny representing the crew's ability to honor the Going Merry's memory while embracing their future.
themes.symbolism: The Thousand Sunny's lion figurehead symbolizes the 'King of Beasts' protecting the future Pirate King, representing strength and royalty.

themes.description: The Franky Family's willingness to lose their boss so he can pursue his dream demonstrates the theme of selfless love and sacrifice for those we care about.
themes.symbolism: The stolen swim briefs represent the Franky Family taking away Franky's ability to refuse, forcing him to accept his own dream.

themes.description: After the intense Enies Lobby arc, this episode provides comedic relief through the absurd underwear chase and bounty photo reactions.
themes.symbolism: The chaotic chase through Water 7 symbolizes the disorder that follows major life changes.

characterSpotlights.development: Franky is torn between his loyalty to his family and his dream of seeing his ship sail the world. The episode shows his vulnerability and his family's understanding of his true desires.
keyActions: Chases his family through Water 7 to retrieve his swim briefs
Is forcibly sent to Scrap Island by the Straw Hats

characterSpotlights.development: Luffy shows his practical leadership by agreeing to take Franky as shipwright and using unconventional methods to recruit him.
keyActions: Views the completed Thousand Sunny with excitement
Agrees to take Franky when the Franky Family begs him
Makes the bargain to exchange briefs for crew membership

characterSpotlights.development: Iceburg reveals the completed ship to the crew, delivering Franky's message about the design.
keyActions: Relays Franky's message about the lion figurehead
quotes: The King of Pirates should sail a ship graced by the King of Beasts.

mangaDifferences.difference: The anime extends the underwear chase sequence with additional comedic moments and townspeople reactions not present in the manga.
The bounty photo reactions are expanded in the anime with additional scenes at Marineford showing the photographer explaining the lens cap mistake.

trivia.fact: The Thousand Sunny is built from Adam wood, one of the strongest and rarest woods in the One Piece world. Franky purchased it on the black market using the money stolen from the Straw Hats in the Water 7 arc.
The episode has an animation error where Franky is briefly shown wearing briefs during the chase sequence when he should be naked.
From Episode 279 to Episode 1070, One Piece episodes did not have ending themes. Episode 321 falls within this range, so it only features the opening theme 'Crazy Rainbow'.
The episode achieved a TV rating of 7.3%, ranking 8th in viewership for its timeslot in Japan.

Kazuki Yao, who voiced Franky in the Japanese version, also voices Mr. 2 Bon Clay in the series. He voiced Franky from the character's debut until retiring from the role in 2024, when he was replaced by Subaru Kimura.
